label: 夷俘
対訳語: captive Ezo [ who had surrendered and had settled inside the empire ]
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: These were Ezo who had accepted the rule of the Imperial Court and had become subjects of the Japanese Empire. The term also refers to their descendants. [蝦夷]
